body:
Comment 2 by **swhite@ngmoco.com**: 
Sorry about the ambiguity, my first examples and errors were against r60.3 and then I
created new ones against trunk after the suggestions in bug 2610.

After reading all the documentation I could find on terminal code... I think the Setctty
option might not be what I thought it was.  The only uses I can see are for processes
that detach from the current session to become their own session leaders and then open a
new tty afterward (i.e. login or screen).  I don't think calling it with fd == 0 will
work and I think it would require setsid before it.

Maybe you can ask the original programmer why this option was put there and if there is
a working example of its use.

In any case, I don't think this option (even if it works) will do what I want it to do. 
I'm not sure if there is a way to keep a child process in the foreground after the
parent exits in bash.
